data.title: The Nuremberg Trials by Heydecker Joe
data.meta_description: The Nuremberg Trials by Joe Heydecker, Johannes Leeb, translated by E. A. Downie and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
xii, 379pp, 8pp half tone photo ills., black cloth lettered and lined in gilt at spine, publisher's device in blind lower board, an account of the trial of the German leaders at the Military Tribunal at Nuremberg. The authors cover first the capture of those facing trial, via their testimony a history of the growth, development and implementation of policy of the National Socialist Party in Germany, and an account of their sentences, a little rubbed and bumped at extrems. with sl. fray at tail of spine, light soiling to cloth, edges tanned with a foe fox and other marks, internally unmarked, no dustwrapper, good plus,

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good condition. Dust Jacket Condition: No dust jacket. First Edition in English. London:: Heinemann, 1962. A square, tight copy. No owner's name or bookplate. No remainder mark. Pages are clean and unmarked but for some tiny brown speckles (foxing) on the endpapers only. No underlining. No highlighting. No margin notes. Illustrated with portraits and photographs, including the shrunken head of a murdered Pole. Originally published in 1958 under the title DER NURNBERGER PROZESS. This first English-language edition translated from the German by E. A. Downie. Bibliography. Index. Edelheit 7681: "Extensive history of Nazi Germany based on the evidence collected at the Nuremberg trials. Deals also with the trials themselves and with the issue of Nazi and Soviet war crimes. The extermination of the Jews is covered on pp. 327-358." Bound in the original black cloth, lettered in bright gilt on the spine. . First Edition in English. Hard Cover. Very Good condition./No dust jacket. 8vo. xii, 379pp. Great Packaging, Fast Shipping.

Hardcover. Condition: Fine condition. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Near Fine dust jacket. First Edition in English. London:: Heinemann, 1962. A bright, shiny, clean, tight copy. Sharp corners. The Dust Jacket is NOT price clipped (42s net). No owner's name or bookplate. No remainder mark. Pages are clean and crisp. No underlining. No highlighting. No margin notes. Illustrated with portraits and photographs, including the shrunken head of a murdered Pole. Originally published in 1958 under the title DER NURNBERGER PROZESS. This English-language edition translated from the German by E. A. Downie. Bibliography. Index. Edelheit 7681: "Extensive history of Nazi Germany based on the evidence collected at the Nuremberg trials. Deals also with the trials themselves and with the issue of Nazi and Soviet war crimes. The extermination of the Jews is covered on pp. 327-358." Bound in the original black cloth, lettered in bright gilt on the spine. . First Edition in English. Hard Cover. Fine condition./Very Near Fine dust jacket. 8vo. xii, 379pp.
